wikipedia_page.main: Sir Stuart James Etherington,  (born 26 February 1955) is a British charity executive and former social worker. From 1994 to 2020, he was chief executive of the National Council for Voluntary Organisations. He was previously the chief executive of the Royal National Institute for Deaf People.

response: * Sir Stuart Etherington (b. 1955), leading charity executive and former social worker, was brought up in the village.
*Stuart Etherington, Chief Executive of the National Council for Voluntary Organisations 1994–present

It was established on 7 July 2016, replacing the Fundraising Standards Board (FRSB). The Regulator developed from recommendations made by the cross-party Review of fundraising regulation chaired by Sir Stuart Etherington in September 2015.

Former Chief Executive of the National Council for Voluntary Organisations (NCVO) Sir Stuart Etherington chaired a review into the self-regulation of charity fundraising in 2015 with a cross-party review panel of three peers; Lord Leigh of Hurley, Baroness Pitkeathley and Lord Wallace of Saltaire.
* Stuart Etherington (born 1955), British charity executive and former social worker
